note.p: Burial Place: Church of the Baraccano

Career: Lecturer in Logic at Bologna (1709); Professor of Theoretical Medicine (1712), then Professor of Practical Medicine at the University of Bologna; taught experimental physics (1714) and chemistry (1734) at the Academy of Bologna; Professor of Chemistry at the University (the first chair of chemistry in Italy) (1737-1749); declined the chair of medicine at Padau and the post of Chief Physician to Pope Benedict XIV
Memberships: Accademia degli Inquieti; Istituto e Accademia bolognesi delle Scienze e delle Arte
Proposers: Sir Thomas Dereham; Sir Hans Sloane; James Jurin
References: Marta Cavazza, 'The Institute of Science of Bologna and the Royal Society in the eighteenth century' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 3-25, plate
